summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 between FBI Victim Services Division personnel, DOJ attorneys, and a CRT representative, coordinating the distribution of invitations and RSVP questionnaires for a victim briefing related to the Epstein case. It discusses confirming victim identities, attorney representation, and logistical details for a meeting scheduled for November 12, 2020.

persons.name: Bob Josefsberg
persons.context: An attorney whose office represents multiple victims; FBI personnel are waiting for his current client list to facilitate invitation distribution.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.role: Victim Specialist or contact providing client lists
persons.context: Provided a list of clients to the FBI; mentioned in the context of obtaining victim contact information for the briefing.

connections.description: Both are involved in providing or coordinating lists of victim clients for the FBI's briefing invitation process.

events.title: Planned Victim Briefing Meeting
events.description: A meeting for victims was being organized, with invitations and RSVP questionnaires being distributed via email to attorneys and some victims directly.

keyFacts: The FBI and DOJ were coordinating a victim briefing for November 12, 2020, requiring careful tracking of victim identities and attorney representation.
There was confusion over whether two listed individuals were the same person, requiring confirmation from the FBI.
Invitations were sent to 14 attorneys (to pass to clients), 6 victims directly, and a family member of a deceased victim.
Attorney Bob Josefsberg's office represented multiple victims, and the FBI was awaiting his current client list.
The communication highlights the logistical challenges in contacting victims, many of whom had multiple attorneys or lacked direct contact information.
